result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas W. Shelley

records.addlTxt: to withdraw as counsel
Review hearing on November 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Re: Order to Withdraw as Counsel

Clerk: Amanda.
Cases called at 9:31 am. 
INCLUDES: 22CF415 and 22CF560. 

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Hannah Runde.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Caroline Carver via zoom audio. 

Date and Time set for Attorney Carver's Motion to Withdraw.  VRCW. 

Court has received the Motion to Withdraw; 
Attorney Carver recites basis for Motion. Defendant explains his withdrawal request. 
Discussions re: revocation issues. State does not take a position. 
Court makes findings. 
Court advises defendant this may cause delay in these matters; 
Court GRANTS Motion for Withdrawal.
